title: Job Openings at Lisse Africa
content:
Lisse Africa is a dynamic human resource consulting firm with key interest in recruitment with the aim of providing employees that are professional, verified and with a good cultural fit. At Lisse Africa, our aim is to build the world's most valued Recruitment Solution Company to Clients, Candidates, Colleagues and the communities where we work and live with regards to staff recruitment, background verification and other HR solutions.

We solely focus on the enhancement of client organizations by providing quality services on various aspects of their human resources and by letting the organization focus on its core issues.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:
     

            
    



1.) Trainee Chef (No Experience Needed)

Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The successful candidate will be required to pass through 4 stages of assessment to be hired.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a minimum of an SSCE qualification
	Must be able to communicate clearly in English
	Must be able to write in English
	Previous experience as a chef is not required
	Must not be more than 35 years of age as at the time of application
	Must be very organised and able to work in a team
	Must be able to commit to the training during the selection period.


Benefits


	N50,000 monthly stipend during the period of training (2months) and 150k monthly salary after successfully completing your training.
	Get certified as a sushi chef
	Accommodation will be provided
	Feeding will be provided


Application Closing Date: 15th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tegarecruits@gmail.com using "Trainee Chef" as the subject of the mail.

Note: You will be required to come for a physical interview.

 

 

2.) Residential Chef

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Cooking various healthy meals
	Preparing customized meal plans for the client based on their preferences, specifications, and dietary needs.
	Shopping for meal ingredients as well as necessary kitchen tools and equipment.
	Inspecting meal ingredients before making purchases to ensure that they are of the highest quality.
	Preparing meals in client’s kitchens in accordance with food health and safety regulations.
	Cleaning and sanitizing work areas before and after meal preparation.
	Appropriately packaging and labeling prepared meals that are to be consumed at a later date.
	Providing clients with written or verbal instructions on how to heat meals.


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE qualification with 3 years of experience.
	Proven culinary experience.
	Sound knowledge of different cuisines, as well as food health and safety regulations.
	Excellent organizational and time management skills.
	Effective communication skills.


Salary
N250,000 - N350,000 Monthly.

Application Closing Date: 10th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications to: tegarecruits@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

 

3.) Housekeeper / Cook

Job Location: Chevron, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dedicated house managerto maintain cleanliness and organisation in a residential setting.
	Experience working is required.
	Responsibilities include performing routine cleaning tasks, such as dusting, vacuuming, mopping floors, and sanitising bathrooms and kitchen areas.
	Cooking basic African dishes
	The ideal candidate should demonstrate attention to detail, reliability, and the ability to work independently.
	Previous experience in cleaning or housekeeping roles is preferred.
	This position offers an opportunity to contribute to creating a comfortable and hygienic environment for residents.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess an SSCE qualification
	Minimum of 2 years of professional housekeeping experience.
	Must be able to cook
	Physical ability to stand for extended periods, bend, lift, push, and move objects.


Salary
N150,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 5th August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: tegarecruits@gmail.com using "House Manager" as the subject of the mail.

Note: There's no provision of accommodation (To come from home daily).

     

    

        Click here to Apply

Customer Trade Marketer Job at AAVA Brands Limited




        
    

        
        AAVA Brands Limited, a new generation company of Chanrai Summit Group (Fareast Mercantile Co. Limited), has been proudly serving Nigeria since 1890 and connects world-class brands to the Nigerian consumer, every day. Now under the umbrella of DP World, AAVA Brands Limited is further strengthened as a flexible and agile service provider. Keeping pace with the evolving needs of African consumers, we strive harder to make the right products available at the right place, in the right time.
     

            
    



We have dedicated our resources to supply chain management through the import / manufacture and distribution of products covering branded Food, Beverages and Fast Moving Consumer Goods for the best multi-nationals in the world. A product portfolio spanning 3,500 SKUs is managed by capable, professional teams, robust infrastructure, and strong delivery systems to ensure availability to consumers every day. As a socially responsible group, we have partnered with various NGOs such as the Tulsi Chanrai Foundation to support their social welfare initiatives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Trade Marketer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (on-site)

Role Description


	This is a full-time on-site role for a Customer Trade Marketing Specialist located in Lagos State, Nigeria.
	The specialist will be responsible for market planning, developing trade marketing strategies, executing promotional activities, and communicating with internal and external stakeholders.
	The role involves analyzing market trends, identifying growth opportunities, and collaborating with sales teams to enhance product visibility and sales.
	The specialist will also monitor and report on the campaign's effectiveness and adjust strategies as necessary to maximize impact.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or related field
	Proficient in Market Planning and Trade Marketing
	Strong Analytical and Communication skills
	Experience in Marketing
	Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams
	Experience in the Alcoholic Beverage Brand is a plus
	Proven track record of managing successful trade marketing campaigns
